headline: Gen Z Rejects 'Radioactive' Diet Sodas for Zero Sugar Ones
summary: Instead, the blind taste-test showdown last year pitted Pepsi Zero Sugar against Coca-Cola Zero Sugar.  At the Super Bowl next month, it’s Zero Sugar that will star in the beverage company’s Pepsi commercial, not the original formula.  “We’ve gone all in” on Pepsi Zero Sugar in the last two years, said Ram Krishnan, the chief executive officer of PepsiCo North America, so much so that the vast majority of its Pepsi marketing budget is spent promoting Zero Sugar.

headline: PepsiCo vs. Vita Coco: Which Beverage Stock Offers Better Growth?
summary: PEP and COCO illustrate contrasting strategies: global scale and diversification versus category focus and premium brand growth.

headline: Khazna Solar And PepsiCo Biomethane Deals Might Change The Case For Investing In Engie (ENXTPA:ENGI)
summary: ENGIE recently reached financial close on its 1.5 GW Khazna Solar PV project in the UAE and agreed a 10‑year biomethane purchase deal with PepsiCo UK, under which it will build an anaerobic digestion plant supplying 60 GWh of green gas annually from 2027. Together, these projects highlight ENGIE’s push into large‑scale renewables and low‑carbon gas, anchoring long‑term contracted revenues across different regions and technologies. We’ll now explore how ENGIE’s Khazna solar milestone and...

headline: PBJ’s Five-Year Return Falls Disappointingly Short
summary: Consumer staples stocks have a reputation for stability, but they rarely deliver the growth that fuels strong long-term returns. The Invesco Food & Beverage ETF (NYSEARCA:PBJ) targets this sector with 89% of its holdings in food and beverage companies. For investors seeking defensive exposure or dividend income, PBJ offers concentrated access to an essential corner ... PBJ’s Five-Year Return Falls Disappointingly Short
